name: Extra Strength Dream Coat Ultra-Moisturizing Anti-frizz Treatment
about: What it is: A powerful treatment that keeps extremely dry, dehydrated hair and curly- and coily hair types silky, glossy, and frizz-free...Hair Texture: Curly and Coily..Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Concerns:.- Dryness.- Frizz.- Straightening and Smoothing..Key Benefits:.- Powerhouse anti-frizz, anti-humidity treatment.- Locks in moisture, blocks out humidity.- Prevents hair from reverting back to frizzy/curly..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Proprietary Anti-Humidity Complex: Humidity-proofs, prevents frizz, adds shine, and provides heat protection..- Polymer Blend: Creates a sealant, locks in moisture, and keeps humidity out..- Glycerin: Powerful humectant moisturizes to help prevent dryness...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: This treatment has a groundbreaking, heat-activated technology that provides powerful humidity-proofing, plus added moisture. It seals the cuticle and locks in moisture to keep extremely dehydrated and curly and coily hair types smooth, sleek, and frizz-resistant, even in the highest humidity...Fragrance Description: This treatment is unscented.
ingredients: -Proprietary Anti-Humidity Complex: Humidity-proofs, prevents frizz, adds shine, and provides heat protection..-Polymer Blend: Creates a sealant, locks in moisture, and keeps humidity out..-Glycerin: Powerful humectant moisturizes to help prevent dryness...Water/Aqua, Dipropylene Glycol, Polysilicone-29, Vp/Methacrylamide /Vinyl Imidazole Copolymer, Silicone Quaternium-18, Glycerin, Trideceth-6, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Polyimide-1, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Trideceth-12, Sodium Benzoate, Chlorphenesin, Potassium Benzoate, Phenylpropanol, Disodium Edta, Propanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Tocopherol, Citric Acid.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Requires blow-drying with tension to activate..-Shampoo, condition, and blot dry with towel..-Divide hair into sections..-Spray liberally and evenly on damp (not wet) hair to completely saturate..-Do not apply other styling products while the hair is wet. .-You can apply styling products after blow-drying..-If using straightening iron, heat should not exceed 380 degrees F (190 degrees C).-For best results, use every three to four shampoos.

reviews.review_text: 3C high porosity hair here. My main interest when buying this product was having my blowout and flat iron last longer when going out. My hair still gets some frizz and reverting towards roots and ends by the time Im back at home after a night out, but really will only ever need a little touch up the next day when I use this. Without it in my routine, its a noticeable difference now. The bottle lasts me about 3-4 styles, but i have A LOT of hair. If you have curly hair don't expect it to be invincible to humidity, but it makes maintaining a heated look easier 100% and is worth the money if you do it often. A tip I have is make sure you really do apply generously before u blowout your hair or its not going to do anything for you. I cant wait for that EXTRA EXTRA strength to come out LOL.

I continued to spray and blow dry the remaining sections and was wowed by the results. My dull, dehydrated-looking hair has been transformed and I love how beautiful and healthy it looks. reviews.review_text: I wasn't sure if this lightweight silicone coat would work on my 4a-b hair texture but it does! Key points to get the sleek results are absolutely not included in directions on the bottle. I wish that the brand included them.  Dream Coat Extra Strength is water-based. Just towel-drying my low porosity hair didn't work. I deep conditioned my hair and then air-dried my hair until it was nearly dry, not damp. That's key step 1. Key step 2:Working in 3-finger width sized sections of hair throughout, I sprayed Dream coat four times per section. I did not apply any other products because that's another key tip to make it work.  I blow dried each section on medium heat with a rounded boar brush. Key step 3: After I completed all the sections, and my hair and roots were completely dry and cooled, I then applied non water-based products, which is key step 4. The only thing I used next was a light application of a lightweight oil (sweet almond oil). Key step 5:I set my Babyliss flat iron to 300 so not to steam my hair. I chased the flat iron with a flat iron straightening comb. My hair looked like a professional silk press! My hair didn't revert, looked glossy and had body and movement.  It was a time consuming process but the end result was gorgeous. I highly recommend this and this was my first time ever using a Color Wow product. I received the product complimentary from the Color Wow for my honest opinion.

reviews.review_title: Works great if you take the time to do it right!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I had the original version and loved that. I went awhile without it (about two years) and just recently purchased the Extra Strength version. I have very fine, thin, long hair. I find that if I take the time to apply and work this product properly, I get great results! But if I rush or do a step incorrectly, I find that I really don't get much in terms of results.   For me, I have to towel dry my hair until it's damp but not wet. Then I section it off, spray liberally, comb the product through and then use a round brush and blow dryer to dry each section, adding tension to the hair at the same time. I blow dry the top and bottom of each section.   If I do anything different - like apply the product when my hair is too wet or too dry, or use a different brush then the one I know works - I get okay results to no real results.   But do it correctly, take your time, and you will love your results and they do last 2 to 3 shampoos for me (I go a day between hair washings, usually).   One other thing to point out, is if you are in a rush and trying to just use a regular brush (like a Wet Brush) and blow dryer, you won't get the results you're looking for. Trust me on this one. And then you've wasted product and I find that, at least with this Extra Strength version, it tends to make my hair a bit tangled since it tends to weigh down the hair.

reviews.review_text: I have used this three times since purchasing.  I have waist long, thick hair of varying textures.  I also do not color my hair and wash once a week (for reference).    What I like about this product is the lighweight feeling it gives my hair.  Other products have a certain tack when I run my hands through it, especially after blow drying.  The Color Wow does not have that feeling, my hair feels a lot cleaner.  Most of my frizz is gone, about 90%.  Also with my extended wash schedule, my hair is not as oil as it once was. I still have to run a flat iron through to get that silky and glassy feel it claims, but the style seems last through hot and humid Ohio Summer days. I also like that I don't have to use 3 or 4 products in combination to get medicore results.  Thus saving me money on product.  What I don't like is that I noticed that I have a lot more flyways and static after using this product, but it is manageable.  Also the ends of my hair seem to have a certain puff going on that was not there with other products.  It is also manageable, but I feel for the price tag, it should not do this.  This is why I knocked off a star and the flatiron business.  All in all, I would recommend this product. Overall I am pretty happy with the results and will continue using this.
